column4: hi, the window decorations of the new theme i want to use were not updated. what can i do? (9.10 + gnome)
do they look wrong, are they not there at all, what's the issue exactly?
they look like the ones i had before
maybe the theme you chose doesn't include window borders and has gtk2 only? or did you install emerald at any point in history and does that still draw the borders?
hmmm
this is the theme → http://www.bisigi-project.org/?p=55&lang=en
and i don't remember that i ever installed emerald
no, emerald is not installed
ok, it also has a metacity theme; in appearance, click customize, then the borders tab, try to apply them
nothing changed
if you run "metacity --replace" in a terminal, does that change anything?
i use compiz → should i do 'compiz --replce'?

well, metacity --replace will indeed kill compiz for the moment, but compiz may also be the issue; else install fustion-icon, run that, it will show in the systray, right click and choose gtk as window decorator
i'll try
fusion-icon I mean btw
again, nothing
check the folder of the theme in /usr/share/themes or ~/.themes
if there is a metacity folder inside, it should work by now; else try the metacity --replace command and check for sensible error output; do "compiz --replace" to get back to compiz
there is a metacity folder and i changed to metacity and switched between some themes, but the borders are still the wrong ones
last shot, then I'm off to bed: if you do "ps -ef | grep [g]nome-settings-daemon" is that daemon running?
ok, then I'm out of options now sorry; maybe someone else here can pick it up
thanks anyway :)
